project-settings.swide-toolchain: SoftConsole workspace has not been generated

core.core-desc: The CoreAHBLite component implements a multi-master AHB-Lite bus. It provides up to 4 AHB-Lite master interfaces, and up to 16 AHB-Lite slave interfaces. It is possible to allocate one or more slave slots to a "combined region" that is accessed through a further slave interface. Slave slots allocated to the combined region are not available for separate connection.

core-param.param-name: Address range seen by slave connected to huge (2GB) slot interface:

core-param.param-value: 4GB addressable space apportioned into 16 slave slots, each of size 256MB

core.core-desc: CoreAhbSram is an AHB slave component which provides access to the SRAM resources available on Actel's Fusion, ProASIC3, ProASIC3E, ProASIC3L, IGLOO, IGLOOe and IGLOO+ devices.
The CoreAHBtoAPB3 is an AHB slave and APB master that bridges between the AHB domain and the APB domain. CoreAHBtoAPB3 can be used to connect between CoreAHB or CoreAHBLite and CoreAPB3.
The CoreAPB3 component implements an APB3 (AMBA3 APB) fabric, which is backwards compatible with APB2 slave peripherals.There is one APB3 Master interface.

core-param.param-name: Number of address bits driven by master:
Position in slave address of upper 4 bits of master address:

core.core-desc: CoreGPIO provides APB access to 32 general purpose IOs, with configurable per bit enabling and interrupt generation.
The Memory Controller is an AHB slave component which supports access to external SRAM and Flash memory resources. The core uses 1 slave slot on the AHB bus.

core-param.param-value: Address A0 bit is the lsb device address

core-param.param-name: Number of wait states for Flash read (1-31):
Number of wait states for Flash write (1-31):
Number of wait states for SRAM 0 read (1-31):
Number of wait states for SRAM 1 read (1-31):
Number of wait states for SRAM 2 read (1-31):
Number of wait states for SRAM 3 read (1-31):
Number of wait states for SRAM 0 write (1-31):
Number of wait states for SRAM 1 write (1-31):
Number of wait states for SRAM 2 write (1-31):
Number of wait states for SRAM 3 write (1-31):
Read and write enables shared for Flash and SRAM?

core.core-desc:
The CoreTimer module is an APB slave that provides access to an interrupt-generating, programmable decrementing counter.
The width of the decrementing counter in the CoreTimer module can be statically configured as either 16 or 32 bits. Programmable registers provide a means to dynamically control the operation of the timer.
Two modes of operation are available for CoreTimer: Continuous mode and One-shot timer mode.

The Cortex-M1 soft IP core is a member of ARM's Cortex family of processors and has been optimized for use in Actel ARM-ready FPGAs. The Cortex-M1 is a general purpose 32-bit microprocessor which offers high performance and small size. Cortex-M1 runs the ARMv6-M instruction set.

core-param.param-value: LE, 0KB ITCM, 0KB DTCM, 1 interrupt, small multiplier, OS extensions absent

core-param.param-name: Instantiate CLKINT buffer for UJTAG clock signal:
Instantiate CLKINT buffer for UJTAG reset signal:

memorysystem.title: Memory Map for M1Proc
memorysystem.description: The project contains the following subsystems:

field.name: Prescale
field.description: Determines effective clock rate for counter relative to PCLK

field.name: TimerIntClr
field.description: Any write to this location will clear the interrupt

field.name: RawTimerInterrupt
field.description: Raw timer interrupt status, active high
